rounds.name: Online Assessment
points: 2-3 frontend coding problems focusing on DOM manipulation and algorithms
Common topics: arrays, strings, basic recursion, and object manipulation
May include MCQs on HTML, CSS, JavaScript fundamentals
Time management is key - aim to complete all problems

rounds.name: Machine Coding Round
points: Build a complete UI component from scratch (e.g., autocomplete, infinite scroll, image carousel)
Focus on clean code, component structure, and vanilla JS or React
Demonstrate responsive design and cross-browser compatibility
Working functionality matters more than pixel-perfect design

rounds.name: Technical Interview (DSA)
points: 1-2 easy-to-medium DSA problems with live coding
Focus on arrays, strings, hash maps, and basic tree traversal
Explain your approach and discuss time/space complexity
May include JavaScript-specific questions (closures, promises, event loop)

rounds.name: Technical Interview (Frontend)
points: Deep dive into React concepts: hooks, state management, component lifecycle
Questions on CSS (Flexbox, Grid, responsive design techniques)
Browser fundamentals: event bubbling, rendering process, performance
Build a small component live and explain your design choices

rounds.name: Hiring Manager / Cultural Fit
points: Discussion about past projects and your role in them
Behavioral questions on teamwork, learning, and handling feedback
Why this company and role? Show genuine interest
Ask thoughtful questions about team structure and growth opportunities

easy: Keep practicing DSA regularly to stay sharp
Network and seek referrals to improve chances
doable: DSA fundamentals are essential - solve 75+ problems
Master React and modern frontend tooling
Prepare for machine coding rounds with timed practice
challenging: Strong DSA is mandatory - aim for 120+ problems
Deep understanding of React internals and optimization
Referrals significantly improve your chances - start networking
stretch: This requires 6-8 months of focused preparation
DSA mastery is non-negotiable at this level
Consider building more experience before targeting unicorns

rounds.name: Online Assessment
points: 3-4 coding problems ranging from easy to medium difficulty
Focus on JavaScript problem-solving and algorithmic thinking
May include frontend-specific challenges (DOM manipulation, async operations)
Passing score typically 60-70% to proceed to interviews

rounds.name: DSA Round 1
points: 1-2 medium problems on arrays, strings, or hash maps
Expected to arrive at optimal solution with hints
Code on shared editors like CoderPad or HackerRank
Interviewer evaluates problem-solving approach and communication

rounds.name: DSA Round 2 / Frontend Fundamentals
points: Could be another DSA round or deep dive into JavaScript internals
Topics: closures, prototypes, event loop, promises, this keyword
Questions on React: virtual DOM, reconciliation, hooks, performance
Write code to demonstrate concepts (e.g., implement Promise.all)

rounds.name: Machine Coding / UI Round
points: Build a real-world component: search with autocomplete, pagination, filters
Use React or vanilla JavaScript based on company preference
Focus on code organization, reusability, and edge case handling
Bonus points for responsive design and accessibility considerations

rounds.name: Hiring Manager / Bar Raiser
points: Behavioral questions using STAR format (Situation, Task, Action, Result)
Deep dive into your best project - technical decisions and trade-offs
Questions about handling challenges, tight deadlines, and collaboration
Culture fit assessment - research company values beforehand

easy: Focus on HTML, CSS, and JavaScript fundamentals
Practice basic coding problems for aptitude tests
Prepare clear explanations of your projects
doable: Strengthen your core frontend skills - HTML, CSS, JS
Learn React basics and build simple applications
Practice common interview questions and coding basics
challenging: Solid understanding of web fundamentals is essential
Build a few portfolio projects to showcase
Focus on communication and explaining concepts clearly
stretch: Focus on fundamentals over advanced concepts
This should be very achievable with basic preparation

rounds.name: Aptitude & Online Test
points: Quantitative aptitude, logical reasoning, and verbal ability
1-2 easy coding problems (basic loops, conditionals, arrays)
MCQs on HTML, CSS, JavaScript basics
Focus on accuracy over speed - cutoff-based filtering

rounds.name: Technical Interview 1
points: Questions on HTML tags, CSS selectors, and JavaScript syntax
Explain concepts: var vs let vs const, event delegation, box model
Simple coding: reverse a string, find duplicates in array
Project discussion - be ready to explain your contributions clearly

rounds.name: Technical Interview 2
points: Deeper dive into JavaScript: closures, hoisting, callbacks
Basic React questions if it's on your resume: JSX, props, state
May ask to build a simple layout or debug existing code
Focus on fundamentals - breadth over depth

rounds.name: HR Interview
points: Standard questions: strengths, weaknesses, why this company
Career goals and willingness to learn new technologies
Salary expectations (be realistic for fresher roles)
Relocation flexibility and notice period discussion

easy: Maintain strong DSA practice - solve problems regularly
Prepare for frontend system design discussions

doable: DSA is the primary filter - solve 150+ LeetCode problems
Master React, performance optimization, and web fundamentals

challenging: DSA mastery is mandatory - aim for 200+ problems (medium/hard)

rounds.name: Recruiter Screen
points: Initial call to verify your background and interest
Overview of the interview process and timeline
Questions about visa status, location preferences, start date
Opportunity to ask about the team and role expectations

rounds.name: Phone/Online Technical Screen
points: 1-2 coding problems on shared editor (CoderPad, Google Docs)
Medium difficulty - arrays, strings, hash maps, or trees
Focus on clean code, edge cases, and optimal time complexity
Strong communication is essential - think out loud throughout

rounds.name: Onsite: Coding Round 1
points: Medium to hard DSA problem with live whiteboard or code editor
Common topics: dynamic programming, trees, graphs, recursion
Interviewer evaluates problem breakdown and optimization
Expect follow-up questions to extend or modify your solution

rounds.name: Onsite: Coding Round 2
points: Another DSA problem, potentially harder or different domain
May involve advanced data structures or complex logic
Write clean, bug-free code under time pressure
Discuss multiple approaches before settling on implementation

rounds.name: Onsite: Frontend System Design
points: Design a frontend system: autocomplete, infinite scroll, feed
Cover component architecture, state management, API design
Discuss performance: lazy loading, code splitting, caching
Address accessibility, error handling, and edge cases

rounds.name: Onsite: Behavioral / Googleyness
points: Amazon: Leadership Principles with STAR format
Google: Googleyness - collaboration, growth mindset, adaptability
Prepare stories about ownership, conflict, learning from failure
Questions like 'Tell me about a time you had to learn something new quickly'

rounds.name: Hiring Committee & Team Match
points: Google: Packet reviewed by hiring committee for final decision
Amazon: Bar raiser provides independent assessment
Team matching calls to find mutual fit
Process can take 2-4 weeks post-onsite

projects.title: Microservices E-Commerce Platform
projects.description: Build a complete e-commerce platform with microservices architecture, including user service, product catalog, order management, payment gateway, and notification service
projects.shortDescription: Full-stack microservices platform with distributed architecture
projects.fullDescription: Design and implement a production-grade e-commerce platform using microservices architecture. Build independent services for users, products, orders, payments, and notifications. Implement API gateway, service discovery, event-driven communication, distributed transactions, and comprehensive monitoring. Deploy on Kubernetes with CI/CD pipelines.

implementationSteps.title: Architecture Design & Service Decomposition
implementationSteps.description: Design the overall system architecture with 5 core services: User Service (authentication, profiles), Product Service (catalog, inventory), Order Service (cart, checkout), Payment Service (gateway integration), and Notification Service (email, SMS). Define service boundaries, data ownership, and API contracts. Choose tech stack: Node.js/Express for services, MongoDB/PostgreSQL for databases, React/Next.js for frontend.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Core Services with Docker
implementationSteps.description: Build each microservice as an independent Docker container. User Service: JWT authentication, password hashing, user CRUD. Product Service: catalog management, search functionality, inventory tracking. Order Service: cart management, order creation, status tracking. Set up separate databases for each service. Implement REST APIs with proper error handling and validation.

implementationSteps.title: API Gateway & Service Communication
implementationSteps.description: Implement API Gateway using Kong or Express Gateway for routing, authentication, rate limiting, and load balancing. Set up service-to-service communication: synchronous (REST/gRPC) for reads, asynchronous (Kafka/RabbitMQ) for events. Implement event-driven patterns: OrderCreated, PaymentProcessed, InventoryUpdated events with message brokers.

implementationSteps.title: Distributed Transactions & Data Consistency
implementationSteps.description: Implement Saga pattern for distributed transactions (e.g., order creation workflow: reserve inventory → process payment → create order → send notification). Handle failure scenarios with compensating transactions. Implement event sourcing for order history. Add Redis for caching product data and session management.

implementationSteps.title: Kubernetes Deployment & CI/CD
implementationSteps.description: Create Kubernetes manifests: Deployments, Services, ConfigMaps, Secrets for each microservice. Set up Helm charts for easier deployment management. Implement horizontal pod autoscaling based on CPU/memory. Build CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions or GitLab CI: automated testing, Docker image building, deployment to Kubernetes cluster. Implement blue-green deployment strategy.

implementationSteps.title: Monitoring, Logging & Frontend Integration
implementationSteps.description: Set up centralized logging with ELK stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana). Implement distributed tracing with Jaeger or Zipkin to track requests across services. Add Prometheus & Grafana for metrics and alerting. Build React/Next.js frontend with micro-frontend architecture for different features. Deploy to production with proper security (HTTPS, API authentication, rate limiting).

projects.title: Real-Time Collaboration Platform
projects.description: Build a collaborative workspace platform with real-time editing, WebSocket connections, document versioning, and multi-user presence
projects.shortDescription: Real-time collaboration tool with WebSockets and CRDT
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-ready collaboration platform similar to Google Docs or Notion. Implement real-time multi-user editing with WebSockets, operational transformation or CRDT for conflict resolution, user presence indicators, document versioning, and rich text editing. Build scalable backend with Redis pub/sub for horizontal scaling.

implementationSteps.title: Backend Architecture with WebSockets
implementationSteps.description: Set up Node.js/Express backend with Socket.io for WebSocket connections. Implement room-based architecture where each document is a room. Handle user connections, disconnections, and reconnection logic. Set up PostgreSQL for document storage and user management. Implement JWT authentication for WebSocket connections. Design document data model with version history.

implementationSteps.title: Real-Time Editing with CRDT
implementationSteps.description: Implement Conflict-Free Replicated Data Types (CRDT) using Yjs library for collaborative editing. Set up Yjs document sync over WebSocket. Handle simultaneous edits from multiple users without conflicts. Implement awareness protocol for cursor positions and user selections. Add debouncing for persistence to reduce database writes.

implementationSteps.title: Frontend with Rich Text Editor
implementationSteps.description: Build React frontend with Slate.js or TipTap for rich text editing. Integrate Yjs bindings for real-time sync. Implement toolbar with formatting options: bold, italic, headings, lists, code blocks. Show live user cursors with names and colors. Display active users list with presence indicators. Add loading states and optimistic updates.

implementationSteps.title: Document Management & Versioning
implementationSteps.description: Create document listing page with create/delete/share functionality. Implement version history: save snapshots every 5 minutes or on significant changes. Build version comparison UI showing diffs between versions. Add rollback capability to restore previous versions. Implement document permissions: owner, editor, viewer roles with proper access control.

implementationSteps.title: Horizontal Scaling with Redis
implementationSteps.description: Set up Redis for pub/sub to enable horizontal scaling across multiple server instances. When a user edits a document, broadcast changes through Redis to all connected servers. Implement Redis adapter for Socket.io. Add rate limiting to prevent abuse. Implement connection pooling for database queries. Test with multiple server instances behind load balancer.

implementationSteps.title: Performance Optimization & Deployment
implementationSteps.description: Implement lazy loading for large documents. Add virtualization for long documents to render only visible content. Set up monitoring with Prometheus/Grafana for WebSocket connections, latency, and memory usage. Optimize bundle size with code splitting. Deploy backend on AWS/GCP with auto-scaling groups. Deploy frontend to CDN (Cloudflare/Vercel). Set up proper CORS and security headers.

projects.title: Cloud-Native SaaS Platform with Multi-Tenancy
projects.description: Build a production-grade SaaS platform with multi-tenancy, subscription management, admin dashboard, analytics, and complete DevOps pipeline
projects.shortDescription: Enterprise SaaS with multi-tenancy and cloud infrastructure
projects.fullDescription: Design and implement a complete cloud-native SaaS platform with organization-level multi-tenancy, Stripe subscription billing, role-based access control, admin analytics dashboard, email notifications, and full infrastructure as code. Deploy on AWS/GCP with auto-scaling, monitoring, and comprehensive CI/CD pipeline. Demonstrates enterprise-level full-stack architecture.

implementationSteps.title: Architecture & Multi-Tenancy Design
implementationSteps.description: Design the SaaS architecture with organization-based multi-tenancy (shared database with org_id isolation). Plan data models: Organizations, Users, Subscriptions, Usage Metrics. Choose tech stack: Next.js 14 with App Router for frontend, Node.js/NestJS for backend APIs, PostgreSQL with row-level security for data isolation, Redis for caching. Set up monorepo with Turborepo or Nx for frontend, backend, and shared packages.

implementationSteps.title: Authentication & Authorization System
implementationSteps.description: Implement authentication with NextAuth.js or Auth0: email/password, social logins (Google, GitHub). Build organization invitation system with email tokens. Create RBAC system with roles: Super Admin, Org Owner, Org Admin, Member, Viewer. Implement middleware for role-based route protection and API authorization. Add audit logging for all administrative actions.

implementationSteps.title: Subscription & Billing with Stripe
implementationSteps.description: Integrate Stripe for subscription management: Free, Pro ($49/mo), Enterprise ($199/mo) plans. Implement Stripe Checkout for plan upgrades/downgrades. Handle webhooks for subscription events: created, updated, canceled, payment failed. Build billing page showing current plan, usage, invoices, and payment method. Implement usage-based limits (API calls, storage) with soft/hard caps. Add metered billing for Enterprise plan.

implementationSteps.title: Core SaaS Features & Admin Dashboard
implementationSteps.description: Build core product features (e.g., project management, analytics, or any domain-specific functionality). Create admin dashboard with: user management, organization settings, usage analytics, activity logs. Implement data visualization with Recharts or Chart.js for key metrics. Add CSV export for reports. Build notification system with email (SendGrid/AWS SES) for important events. Implement in-app notifications with real-time updates.

implementationSteps.title: Infrastructure as Code & Cloud Deployment
implementationSteps.description: Write Terraform scripts for AWS/GCP infrastructure: VPC, RDS (PostgreSQL), ElastiCache (Redis), S3 buckets, CloudFront CDN, Lambda functions. Set up separate environments: dev, staging, production with environment-specific configs. Implement auto-scaling for backend services. Configure load balancer with health checks. Set up CloudWatch/Stackdriver for monitoring and alerting. Implement backup strategy for databases.

implementationSteps.title: CI/CD, Monitoring & Production Readiness
implementationSteps.description: Build comprehensive CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions: linting, testing (unit/integration/e2e), Docker builds, deployment to staging on PR, production deployment on merge to main. Set up Datadog or New Relic for APM (Application Performance Monitoring). Implement error tracking with Sentry. Add structured logging with Winston or Pino. Create runbooks for common issues. Implement feature flags with LaunchDarkly or custom solution. Add comprehensive test coverage (>80%).
